column4: possibly a dumb question; can I write files to a samba share from my windows system without it being fat32?
I'm SSH'd into my LAMP server which I've installed Samba on
I can't be arsed to create a fat32 partition
oh
in other words, I _have_ to use either a fat32 or ntfs partition?
to enable Ntfs writing use Ntfs-3g
whoa... too much at once
I've heard that automatix is a broken for newer revs
I have a little question, why the "Eject" option has lost from an Usb device context menu
It was there in Edgy
also, I don't have an ntfs or fat32 partition (yet) under my linux machine
ideally I'd like to avoid doing that, out of pure lazyness
I have a little question, why the "Eject" option has lost from an Usb device context menu
It was there in Edgy
so I should just update to Feisty?
I have a little question, why the "Eject" option has lost from an Usb device context menu
It was there in Edgy
also, is ntfs write reliable? I ask because I know there's a major difference between something being unsupported, and that same thing functioning as expected regardless of unsupportedness
I have a little question, why the "Eject" option has lost from an Usb device context menu
It was there in Edgy
i am using it and i can say it is reliable
